items.title: Paging slip
items.description: Paging slip representation of item, request and requester

innReachTransaction.description: Paging slip representation of an INN-Reach transaction

centralServerCode.description: Unique code that identifies the central server

centralServerId.description: UUID of the central server configuration

localServerCode.description: Unique code that identifies the local server

item.description: Paging slip representation of an item

title.description: Primary title (or label) associated with an item

barcode.description: Unique inventory control number for physical resources, used largely for circulation purposes

effectiveCallNumber.description: Effective call number, an identifier assigned to the item or its holding

shelvingOrder.description: A system generated normalization of the call number that allows for call number sorting in reports and search results

hrid.description: The human readable ID, also called eye readable ID. A system-assigned sequential alternate ID

effectiveCallNumberComponents.description: Elements of a full call number generated from the item or holding

callNumber.description: Effective Call Number is an identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

prefix.description: Effective Call Number Prefix is the prefix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

suffix.description: Effective Call Number Suffix is the suffix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

typeId.description: Effective Call Number Type Id is the call number type id assigned to the item or associated holding.

volume.description: Volume is intended for monographs when a multipart monograph (e.g. a biography of Gerorge Bernard Shaw in three volumes)

enumeration.description: Enumeration is the descriptive information for the numbering scheme of a serial, usually identified by level and a descriptive caption, e.g., level 0 = v. and level 1 = no. This means that each issue of the serial has a volume and an issue number that would appear (e.g. v.71:no.6-2)

chronology.description: Chronology is the descriptive information for the dating scheme of a serial, usually identified by level, e.g., level 0 = year level 1 = month. This means that each issue of the serial has a month and a year on each issue (e.g. 1985:July-Dec.)

copyNumber.description: Copy number is the piece identifier. The copy number reflects if the library has a copy of a single-volume monograph; a copy of a multi-volume, (e.g. Copy 1, or C.7.)
